title: Aliosky
author: Aliosky
content: Since independence violence has been a frequent practice and nearly every general election held in Nigeria has been affected by violence. My mother used to tell me stories of how people are fighting and killing themselves, so ever since I was a young child when an election is approaching i always had this fear. A lot of bad things happen during election which results to loss of lives and properties.My people! As Election day is quickly approaching with only a few days left. I've heard reports and seen evidence in my community of politicians using some young people as weapons of violence. Let everyone know that no matter what we do, our lives are much more valuable than the meager sums of money we are given to use as justification for violence against others.Let everyone know that voting is about exercising one's freedom to choose their candidates, not battling someone else because they did not vote for their preferred candidate. Please let know our point of view can never be the same, with that I don't see any reason why we should let politicians use us as a tool of violence.Please i urge my fellow youths to refrain from letting any politician take advantage of us and we should turn out in large numbers on election days to cast our votes for the betterment of this country. As we all pray for free and fair election may we all witness it. Amen

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: If you look well at the people been use for this political thuggery of a thing you find mostly the illiterate ones at the fore front of it. People can’t express their political views without engaging freely in Arguments which are not constructive and this later ends with fights. One thing I always tell this kind of people is where are the children of these politicians? 90% chance they are abroad until the Chaos is over. The thing we all Nigerians most especially the youths needs to know is this fights is against bad government and not against ourselves because even the politicians we are fighting for are mostly friends.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: From my own point of view, politics in Nigeria has always been a dilemma. It's left for us to work towards the change we talk about; the youth have always been the politicians' targeted audience for violence, electoral property destruction, and ballot box hijacking. Unless those who are always involved in election crises decide to change on their own, there is nothing that we say here that is going to add any positive change.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: The election in Nigeria has become a tug of war. Our politicians  have made the Nigerian youth an object of violence to achieve their goals (fame, power, and money), which has led to the loss of lives and properties among Nigerians. In my estimation, it is high time Nigerian youth said a big NO to any politician who wants to use them during the forthcoming election to cause trouble. because the politicians will only remember the youth during elections. The moment they are in power, the youth will be forgotten again. I see no reason to fight for those who are unable to provide job opportunities for graduates or security for their citizens. They all leave their families abroad, leaving the poor masses to suffer in Nigeria. There is currently no good educational environment, and they will seek to use the youth as weapons of violence during the election.

So youths should not let their right be taken away from in exchange of chicken change and fake promises, they should fight for their right and their future.
